bioghist.p: Hildegarde Lasell Watson (1888-1976) was a musician, concert soprano, and author who was a friend of Marianne Moore and E.E. Cummings. She was married to James Sibley Watson, a publisher and filmmaker. He directed Lot in Sodom and The Fall of the House of Usher; Hildegarde Watson had roles in both of these films.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of the personal papers of Hildegarde Watson. Materials include: correspondence with family and friends; manuscripts of her memoirs; photos, photo albums, slides, and cabinet cards; programs, announcements, reviews, phonograph albums, and publicity photos from Watson's singing career; sketchbooks, loose sketches, and photographic reproductions of sketches by Watson; newspaper clippings; appointment books and address books; and a series of small books containing poems by Watson and others.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Rosenbach Museum & Library: Marianne Moore papers; University of Rochester, Special Collections: Marianne Moore: Letters to Hildegarde Watson (1933-1964).
